p: The M-M system reduced irrigation, increased WUE, and reduced groundwater consumption, which could also be explained by growing two, rather than one, C 4 crops (maize) annually. WUE is known to be greater for C 4 cereals than for C 3 cereals 26. In addition, the demand for water and the occurrence of precipitation coincided temporally in the new system ( Table 4). More than 90% of precipitation occurred during the maize growth period in the M-M system ( Supplementary Fig. S2). The annual water requirements for the M-M system in experiment II were 589 mm in 2013 and 585 mm in 2014 ( Table 4). Thus, the gaps between water supplied by precipitation and water demand by the M-M system were 155 mm in 2013 and 214 mm in 2014.
